greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = prime(2*n) - 2*prime(n).
comment: a(n)=A031215(n)-A100484(n)=A072473(n)-A000040(n); see A179740 for primes. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 25 2010
Asymptotically, a(n) ~ log(4) n, with log(4) = 2 log 2 = 1.38629436111989... = A016627. - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 19 2013
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
program: (PARI) { for (n = 1, 1000, a=prime(2*n) - prime(n)*2; write("b066066.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ - _Harry J. Smith_, Nov 09 2009
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 01 2001
